div.div: This search form uses an instant search feature. As you type, search results will appear automatically below the search field. When you've entered you desired search terms use tab to navigate through the available results and hit enter to open the selected page or document.

p.strong: Oklahoma State Department of Education Distance Learning Resources:

div.p: Medication Pick-Up: Parents and legal guardians may pick-up their student’s prescription medication from their school site between 9:00-12pm on Monday, March 23rd, 2020. Photo identification card is required to pick-up the medication and must be on the student's permission list.
Special Olympics: Special Olympics Oklahoma has made the very difficult decision to cancel all activities.
Will Latchkey be open during the closure? Latchkey services will not be available during the closure.
Will students be required to take state tests? Per the Oklahoma State Department of Education, students will not be taking state tests for the Spring 2020 semester.
Will summer school continue as planned? At this time, summer school is scheduled to continue.
Concurrent College Classes: Students will need to contact their college for specific information regarding instruction.

div.p: All Oklahoma Schools will remain closed for the remainder of the school year. This has been mandated by the State Department of Education.

The State Board of Education voted 7-0 to keep Oklahoma school buildings closed, implement distance learning plans for the remainder of the school year due to #COVID19 pandemic. In-person instruction & extracurricular activities are cancelled, but "learning must continue," said State Superintendent Hofmeister.

STARTING 4-13-2020: Breakfast/lunch will be served as a drive-thru service on MONDAYS and THURSDAYS (ONLY) from 9:30-11:00 a.m. Meals can be picked up for any child ages 18 and under for free. Children must be present to receive meals.
Drive-thru near cafeteria doors

Unfortunately, we are not going to be able to have school sponsored proms this year. We will put together a process for issuing refunds to students who have prepaid for any activity that has been canceled. We will let you know when that plan is finalized.

At this time, we have the Jim Norick Arena reserved for May 23rd for three high school graduations. If it becomes impossible to keep that date, we will look at doing something else on that date. If you’ve ordered graduation announcements and caps and gowns, you can contact your high school about what to expect. We plan on recognizing our seniors - at the Fairgrounds or not - to celebrate our graduates on May 23rd. We will also consider doing something in the summer. We will update you as soon as we have more information.

All extra-curricular activities, including all OSSAA activities, are canceled during school closures. This includes all practices, tryouts, auditions, clinics, programs, games and events related to athletics, fine arts and academic enrichment programs.
